title: Yauaa config file with matching rules, lookups/sets and tests
description: This file can contain a mix of rules and tests that define the patterns Yauaa must respond to

config.description: The collection of all Yauaa config entries

Yauaa.title: Yauaa config file
Yauaa.description: This file can contain a mix of rules and tests that define the patterns Yauaa must respond to

Config.title: Config
Config.description: The collection of all Yauaa config entries

name.description: The name of the lookup as it must be referenced in matcher rules.

additionalProperties.description: A mapping from a key to the provided value.

items.description: The name of another lookup that must be merged.

merge.description: A set of lookup names to merge

Lookup.title: Lookup
Lookup.description: A Lookup maps a provided input value to the shows output value.

name.description: The name of the set as it must be referenced in matcher rules.

items.description: The name of another set or lookup that must be merged. If it is a lookup then the keys of the lookup are merged into the set.

merge.description: A set of set/lookup names to merge

Set.title: Set
Set.description: A collection of values that can be used in pattern detection

variable.description: A set of patterns that are (if found) assigned to a variable name to be used by later rules. If any of the patterns is not found then the entire Matcher is skipped.

require.description: A set of patterns that must be found. If any of the patterns is not found then the entire Matcher is skipped.

extract.description: A set of patterns that are (if found) assigned to the final property at the provided confidence. If any of the patterns is not found then the entire Matcher is skipped.

Matcher.title: Matcher
Matcher.description: A single matcher that either matches all underlying requirements and extracts some values, or does nothing.

user_agent_string.description: The 'User-Agent' header field contains information about the user agent originating the request.

User-Agent.description: The 'User-Agent' header field contains information about the user agent originating the request.

Sec-Ch-Ua.description: The Sec-CH-UA request header field gives a server information about a user agent's branding and version.

Sec-Ch-Ua-Arch.description: The Sec-CH-UA-Arch request header field gives a server information about the architecture of the platform on which a given user agent is executing.

Sec-Ch-Ua-Bitness.description: The Sec-CH-UA-Bitness request header field gives a server information about the bitness of the architecture of the platform on which a given user agent is executing.

Sec-CH-UA-Form-Factors.description: The Sec-CH-UA-Form-Factors request header field gives a server information about the user agent's form-factors.

Sec-Ch-Ua-Full-Version.description: The Sec-CH-UA-Full-Version request header field gives a server information about the user agent’s full version. Sec-CH-UA-Full-Version is deprecated and will be removed in the future. Developers should use Sec-CH-UA-Full-Version-List instead.

Sec-Ch-Ua-Full-Version-List.description: The Sec-CH-UA-Full-Version-List request header field gives a server information about the full version for each brand in its brands list.

Sec-Ch-Ua-Mobile.description: The Sec-CH-UA-Mobile request header field gives a server information about whether or not a user agent prefers a 'mobile' user experience.

Sec-Ch-Ua-Model.description: The Sec-CH-UA-Model request header field gives a server information about the device on which a given user agent is executing.

Sec-Ch-Ua-Platform.description: The Sec-CH-UA-Platform request header field gives a server information about the platform on which a given user agent is executing. Its value SHOULD match one of the following common platform values: 'Android', 'Chrome OS', 'iOS', 'Linux', 'macOS', 'Windows', or 'Unknown'.

Sec-Ch-Ua-Platform-Version.description: The Sec-CH-UA-Platform-Version request header field gives a server information about the platform version on which a given user agent is executing.

Sec-Ch-Ua-WoW64.description: The Sec-CH-UA-WoW64 request header field gives a server information about whether or not a user agent binary is running in 32-bit mode on 64-bit Windows.

input.title: Input
input.description: The provided input that is to be fed into Yauaa.

expected.title: Expected
expected.description: The expected output from Yauaa assuming the provided input.

Test.title: Test
Test.description: A test to ensure given the defined input the expected final values all appear.
